alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 6:46PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Minor roadway flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...Highway 395 south of Lone Pine and State Route 190 in southern Inyo County. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water has been reported flowing over Highway 395 near Olancha RV Park and low lying portions of State Route 190. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM PST, Flooding remains ongoing near Highway 395 and Cactus Flats with minor flooding reported earlier and snow melt continuing. There has been at least one traffic accident reported as a result of this flooding. - Highway 395 near Olancha RV Park and State Route 190 are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. The advisory area is expected to freeze overnight, which will make for slick road conditions. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Olancha, Cartago, Keeler, Grant, State Route 190 between Highway 395 and Saline Valley Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
